com.alicecallsbob.fcsdk.android.phone

Interface AudioDeviceManager

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ListenerTarget<AudioDeviceManagerListener>

    public interface AudioDeviceManager
extends ListenerTarget<AudioDeviceManagerListener>
    Manages the audio device options presented by the hardware.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  AudioDeviceManager.AudioDevice 
      static class  AudioDeviceManager.AudioManagerState

    • Method Detail

      • updateAudioDeviceState

        void updateAudioDeviceState()
        Trigger the checking of all connected audio devices

      • updateAudioDeviceState

        void updateAudioDeviceState(boolean forceSetting)
        Trigger the checking of all connected audio devices and force the setting to be made

      • start

        boolean start()
        Start the AudioDeviceManager service
        Returns:
        true if the service started correctly

      • stop

        boolean stop()
        Stop the AudioDeviceManager service
        Returns:
        true if the service stopped correctly

      • setDefaultAudioDevice

        void setDefaultAudioDevice(AudioDeviceManager.AudioDevice defaultDevice)
        Changes the default audio device. This will be used if there is no headset, wired or Bluetooth. Removing a wired headset or powering off a Bluetooth device will cause fallback to this device.
        Parameters:
        defaultDevice - The device to set as default, either Speaker or Earpiece

      • setAudioDevice

        void setAudioDevice(AudioDeviceManager.AudioDevice defaultDevice)
        Set the currently in use audio device. This will then trigger a refresh of all the devices's state. Only values that have been returned by getAudioDevices() are valid.
        Parameters:
        defaultDevice - The device to set as the current device.

      • getSelectedAudioDevice

        AudioDeviceManager.AudioDevice getSelectedAudioDevice()
        The currently in-use device
        Returns:
        The device currently selected for Audio

      • getAudioDevices

        java.util.Set<AudioDeviceManager.AudioDevice> getAudioDevices()
        Get the list of currently connected and valid AudioDevices
        Returns:
        The valid list
